#!/bin/bash # # while for the img-storage user to appear
while [ ! `id -u &imgstorage-user;` ];do sleep 5 done
# so udevd sees that there is not img-storage group at boot time # then it caches that value for the 91-zfs-permissions.rules # # to stop this behaviour we need to touch the file # so udev will reparse the rules and properly load the group # # 1 day of debugging to figure this out! touch /etc/udev/rules.d/91-zfs-permissions.rules /sbin/udevadm trigger --sysname-match=zfs
# we need this only the first boot after the installation # after that the file will be there rm /etc/rc.d/rocksconfig.d/post-50-restart-udev-zfs-perm
